text: A Dinuclear Cd(II) Cluster-based Coordination Polymer: Synthesis, Structure and Luminescence Property
XUELi-Ping(薛丽平) College of Food and Drug,Luoyang Normal University, Luoyang 471934, China

ABSTRACT One two-dimensional coordination polymer with a formula of {[Cd(L)(imidazole) $( \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O } ) ] ( \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O } ) \} _ { \mathrm { n } }$ (1） was obtained by the synthetic reactions in aqueous solution using a newly synthesized $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ 0 $\mathrm { { H _ { 2 } L } = }$ methyl-3-hydroxy-5-carboxy-2-thiophenecarboxylate） ligand. Compound 1 crystallizes in monoclinic system, space group $C 2 / c$ with $a = 1 8 . 3 1 7 6 ( 1 1 ) .$ $b = 8 . 5 3 6 6 ( 9 )$ ， $c = 8 . 4 1 5 2 ( 5 ) \ \mathring { \mathrm { A } } , \beta$ $= 1 0 1 . 7 8 9 ( 6 ) ^ { \circ }$ ,V = 2797.1(3) $\mathring { \mathbf { A } } ^ { 3 }$ $D _ { c } = 1 . 9 7 9 ~ \mathrm { g / c m ^ { 3 } }$ $\mathrm { C _ { 1 0 } H _ { 1 2 } N _ { 2 } O _ { 7 } S C d }$ $M _ { r } = 4 1 6 . 6 8$ ， $F ( 0 0 0 ) = 1 6 4 8$ $\mu = 1 . 7 4 5$ （204号 $\mathrm { m m ^ { - 1 } }$ ， $F ( 0 0 0 ) = 1 6 4 8$ ，the final $R = 0 . 0 3 2 3$ and $w R = 0 . 0 6 0 4$ for 2604 observed reflections with $I > 2 \sigma ( I )$ Structure analyses reveal that the compound is constructed by dinuclear Cd(II) clusters bridged by two hydroxyl oxygens of $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - }$ anions, which features a two-dimensional network with 4-connected sql topology. Furthermore,the compound exhibits high thermal stability and intense fluorescent emisson,and could be explored for potential luminescent materials.
Keywords: methyl-3-hydroxy-5-carboxy-2-thiophenecarboxylate;topology; luminescence property; DOI: 10.14102/j.cnki.0254-5861.2011-1666
1 INTRODUCTION

Recently,a great deal of attention has been focused on the assembly of coordination polymers (CPs) owing to their various intriguing constructions and potential applications as functional materials[l-6]. In order to synthesize novel CPs,the rational design and assembly of metal ions or metal clusters with diverse multifunctional bridging linkers are sensible and efectivel7-10l.Among them,organic bridging linkers containing multidentate carboxylic acids have been fully used as building blocks in crystal engineering. However，building blocks based on thiophenedicarboxylic acids for assembly are still rare.In recent years,our group and others have been involved in thesynthesisof CPsconstructed from various thiophenedicarboxylic acids，such as2,5-thiophenedicarboxylic acid，3,4-thiophenedicarboxylicacid, 2,3-thiophenedicarboxylic acid and 3-nitro-2,5-thiophenedicarboxylic acid,and many interesting CPs have been reported[11-15].

In this regard, the methyl-3-hydroxy-5-carboxy-2-thiophenecarboxylate $\mathrm { ( H _ { 2 } L ) }$ was selected as a precursor trying to construct CPs because the new thiophene-2,5-dicarboxylic acid derivative has multiple potential coordination sites involving carboxyl，hydroxyl and carbomethoxyl groups.In addition,the Cd(Il ion with larger ionic radius is able to tolerate various coordination numbers and geometries in crystal engineering. Encouraged by these findings above mentioned, we choose $\mathrm { H _ { 2 } L }$ and imidazole mixed linkers to investigate its assembly with the Cd(I) ion.Fortunately,one two-dimensional CP constructed from dinuclear Cd(II) clusters was obtained. The compound with 4-connected sql topology is then characterized by infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR)and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA). Moreover, the luminescent property of the compound has also been investigated.
2 EXPERIMENTAL

All reagents and solvents were purchased commercially and used without further purification. The IR spectra were recorded as KBr pellets on a Nicolet Avatar-36O spectrometer in the range of 4000 to $4 0 0 \ \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ ： Elemental analyses forC,H,and N were carried out ona Flash 2OOO elemental analyzer.The TGA was carried out on a SDTQ6OO thermogravimetric analyzer. A platinum pan was used for heating the sample with a heating rate of $1 0 \ \mathrm { ^ { \circ } C / m i n }$ under air atmosphere. Fluorescence measurements were recorded with a Hitachi F4500 fluorescence spectrophotometer.
2.1Synthesis of the compound {[Cd(L)(imidazole) $( \mathbf { H _ { 2 } O } ) ] ( \mathbf { H _ { 2 } O } ) \} _ { \mathbf { n } } \left( \mathbf { 1 } \right)$

A mixture of $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ (20.2 mg, 0.1 mmol), $\mathrm { C d } ( \mathrm { O A c } ) _ { 2 } { \cdot } 2 \mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O }$ ? $( 2 6 . 7 ~ \mathrm { m g } , 0 . 1 ~ \mathrm { m m o l } )$ ，imidazole（ $1 3 . 6 2 ~ \mathrm { m g }$ ，0.2 mmol),NaOH (2.00 mg,0.05 mmol) and $4 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ deionized water was sealed in a $2 0 ~ \mathrm { m L }$ Pyrex glass tube and heated at $8 0 \ \mathrm { ~ } ^ { \circ } \mathrm { ~ C ~ }$ for $7 2 \mathrm { { h } }$ , followed by cooling to room temperature at a rate of 5 $\mathrm { ^ \circ C } \cdot \mathrm { h } ^ { - 1 }$ . Block yellow crystals were collected (yield: $62 \%$ based on Cd). Elemental analysis calcd. $( \% )$ for $\mathrm { C _ { 1 0 } H _ { 1 2 } C d N _ { 2 } O _ { 7 } S }$ : C, 28.79; H, 2.88; N, 6.72. Found $( \% )$ : C, 28.81; H, 2.89; N, 6.69. Selected IR peaks (KBr, $\mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } } .$ ): 3517 (s),3357 (m), 3296 (m), 2639 (m),1593 (s),1536 (s),1464 (s),1433 (s),1375 (s),1342 (s),1166 (m),920 (m),836 (m),755 (m),734 (m),715 (m),686 (m).
2.2 $\mathbf { X }$ -ray structure determination

A suitable crystal of compound 1 was mounted on a glass fiber using a viscous hydrocarbon oil to coat the crystal.Crystal structure determination diffraction data of compound 1 were collected on an Oxford Diffraction SuperNova Eos2 difractometer equipped with a graphite-monochromatic MoKα radiation at 293(2) K. The data were collcted and processed using the CrysAlisPro software,and the structures were solved using the Olex2 program as an interface together with the SHELXS and SHELXL programs,in order to solve and refine the structure,respectivelyl16-18l. Heavy atoms were refined anisotropically. Except that the aqueous hydrogen atoms were determined from difference Fourier maps and fixed the distances of O-H $( 0 . 8 5 \mathrm { \AA } )$ ，the other hydrogen atoms were added in the riding model without refinement. Selected bond distances $( \mathring \mathbf { A } )$ and bond angles ${ \bf \Pi } ^ { ( \circ } )$ of1 are summarized in Table 1. The final $R = 0 . 0 3 2 3$ and $w R = 0 . 0 6 0 4$ for 2604 observed reflections with $I > 2 \sigma ( I )$ and $R = 0 . 0 4 1 8$ and $w R = 0 . 0 6 3 4$ for all data. $( \Delta \rho ) _ { \mathrm { m a x } } = 0 . 6 4 1$ ， $( \Delta \rho ) _ { \mathrm { m i n } } = - 0 . 4 9 6 ~ \mathrm { e } / \mathring { \mathrm { A } } ^ { 3 }$ （204号 and $S = 1 . 0 6 1$ ：
3 RESULTSANDDISCUSSION
3. 1 Crystal structure

Complex 1 was obtained as block yellow crystalline materials by the reaction of $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ and cadmium acetate with imidazole in aqueous medium. It should be noted that the weak basic $\mathrm { p H }$ values in the starting reaction solutions are essential to successully prepare the compound. Attempts to synthesize 1 in an acidic or neutral pH value failed.The reasons may be because the weak basic environments could facilitate $\mathrm { H _ { 2 } L }$ deprotonation and make it easy to coordinate with $\mathrm { C d ^ { 2 + } }$ ion,which was also consistent with the single-crystal $\mathrm { \Delta } X$ -ray analysis.

Complex 1 crystallizes in monoclinic space group $C 2 / c$ ，and there exist one $\mathrm { C d ^ { 2 + } }$ ion, one $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - }$ anion, one imidazole ligand,one coordinated water molecule and one lattce water molecule in the asymmetric unit (Fig. 1). The $\mathrm { C d ^ { 2 + } }$ ion shows a distorted octahedral geometry, coordinated by four oxygen atoms from three $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - }$ （204 anions,one imidazole nitrogen atom from one terminal imidazole ligand and one coordinated water molecule.

img_caption: Fig.1. Coordination environment of the $\mathbf { C d ( I I ) }$ center.Hydrogen atomsare omitted forclarity.

text: The bond length of Cd-N is 2.263(3) $\mathring \mathrm { A }$ ，while the Cd-O bond lengths range from 2.265(2) to 2.379(2) A, which are in the normal rangel19,20]. The O-Cd-Oangles range between 77.34(9)and $1 7 1 . 3 1 ( 9 ) ^ { \circ }$ ， and the O-Cd-N angles can be found in the $8 6 . 1 6 ( 1 1 ) { \sim } 1 6 1 . 9 4 ( 1 1 ) ^ { \circ }$ region (Table 2).

In 1, each $L ^ { 2 - }$ anion in a tridentate $\mu _ { 3 ^ { - } } ( \eta ^ { 2 } ) – ( \eta ^ { 1 } ) – ( \eta ^ { 1 } )$ bridging mode links adjacent $\mathrm { C d ^ { 2 + } }$ ions, thereby generating a 2D layer structure running parallel to the $b c$ plane,which is further decorated by the terminal imidazole ligand (Fig. 2a and Fig. 2b). In 1, a pair of $\mathrm { C d ^ { 2 + } }$ ions is bridged by a pair of hydroxyl oxygen atoms to give a dinuclear $\mathrm { C d } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O } _ { 2 }$ cluster with a shorter Cd..Cd separation of $3 . 5 5 0 0 \mathring { \mathrm { A } }$ . In topology, such a $\mathrm { C d } _ { 2 } \mathrm { O } _ { 2 }$ （204号 cluster can be viewed as a 4-connected node to link four other equivalent ones through four $L ^ { 2 - }$ anions, thus forming a 4-connected sql-type network with $4 ^ { 4 } { \cdot } 6 ^ { 2 }$ topology (Fig. 2c). Moreover, such 2D layers are extended into an overall three-dimensional (3D） network by intermolecular $\mathrm { O - H \cdot \cdot \cdot O }$ interactions between the lattice water(O(7)） and oxygen atomsof $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - } / \mathrm { o r }$ coordinated water molecule (O(7)-H(3W).·O(5), O(7)-H(3W).\*.O(6) and $\mathrm { O } ( 7 ) { \mathrm { - H } } ( 4 \mathrm { W } ) { \cdot \cdot \cdot } \mathrm { O } ( 5 )$ ； Table 2 lists the detailed hydrogen-bonding geometry)，as shown in Fig. 2d.

img_caption: Fig.2.(a) 2D layer structure in1. (b) 2D layer decorated by imidazole ligand.

text: (c) Schematic representation of the 4-connected sql topology.(d) View of the 3D hydrogen-bonded network

In addition,this structure also contains intramolecular hydrogen-bonding involving carbonyl and terminal imidazole moieties $( \mathrm { N } ( 2 ) \mathrm { - } \mathrm { H } ( 2 ) \cdot \cdot \cdot \mathrm { O } ( 4 )$ and O(6)-H(2W).\*·O(5); see Table 2 for detailed hydrogen-bonding geometry), which further promote the stability and integrity of the 3D supramolecular network.
3.2IR spectrum and thermal study

In compound 1, IR spectra exhibit strong absorption centered at $3 5 1 7 { \sim } 2 6 3 9 ~ \mathrm { c m } ^ { - 1 }$ ,corresponding to the N -H/O-H stretching vibration of imidazole ligand or water molecule.In the characteristic stretching vibrations of the carboxylate groups,the absorbance peaks in the $1 5 9 3 \sim 1 5 3 6$ and $1 3 4 2 { \sim } 1 4 6 4 \ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ ranges are atributed to the asymmetric and symmetric stretching,respectively. The absence of absorption peak at the $1 6 9 0 { \sim } 1 7 3 0 ~ \mathrm { c m ^ { - 1 } }$ region suggests the complete deprotonation of carboxylate groups in the $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ ligand. The thermal stability of 1 was investigated on the crystalline sample at a heating rate of $1 0 ~ \mathrm { ^ { \circ } C ~ \ m i n ^ { - 1 } }$ under air atmosphere.As seen in Fig. 3,a two-step weight loss was observed.The first step of weight loss (observed: $7 . 6 2 \%$ ）between 57 and $1 1 7 \mathrm { ~ } ^ { \circ } \mathrm { ~ C ~ }$ was attributable to the release of two water molecules (expected: $7 . 6 8 \%$ ). A steady platform appears in the temperature region of $1 1 7 \sim 2 3 4 \textrm { ~ \textdegree C }$ . Further heating gives rise to the continuous weight loss due to the decomposition of organic moieties.
3.3Luminescent property

img_caption: Fig. 4.Solid-state emission spectra of 1 and the free $\mathbf { H _ { 2 } L }$ ligand measured at room temperature

text: Since compound 1isstable in air and insoluble in water or most organic solvents,the luminescent properties of the crystalline sample of 1 and the $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ ligand were investigated in the solid state at room temperature. As seen in Fig.4,complex 1 exhibits fluorescent emission with the maxima at 430 nm $\lambda _ { \mathrm { e x } } = 2 7 2$ （204号 nm). Such fluorescence behavior may be attributed to the intraligand transition of coordinated $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - }$ anions since similar emission at $4 5 2 \ \mathrm { n m }$ $( \lambda _ { \mathrm { e x } } = 2 7 6 \ \mathrm { n m }$ ）was observed for the free $\mathrm { H } _ { 2 } \mathrm { L }$ ligand. The blue-shifted emission of 1 was caused by the coordination of $\mathrm { L } ^ { 2 - }$ anions to the metal centers[21].
4 CONCLUSION

In the present study, a $\operatorname { C d } ( \mathrm { I I } )$ coordination polymer containing dinuclear $\operatorname { C d } ( \operatorname { I I } )$ clusters was successfully constructed and characterized. The single-crystal X-ray diffraction shows that the $L ^ { 2 - }$ anion takes a bidentate $\mu _ { 2 ^ { - } } ( \eta ^ { 1 } , \eta ^ { 1 } ) – ( \eta ^ { 1 } )$ bridging mode to link adjacent Cd(II) ions, forming a 2D layer structure with 4-connected sql topology，which are further connected by O-H..O hydrogen bonding interactions to form a 3D supramolecular framework.Moreover,the compound exhibits high thermal stability and intense fluorescent emission, and can be explored for potential luminescent materials.

text: A Dinuclear Cd(II) Cluster-based Coordination Polymer: Synthesis, Structure and Luminescence Property
XUELi-Ping(薛丽平)
One 2D dinuclear Cd(II） cluster-based coordination polymer with 4-connected sql topology was obtained using a new methyl-3-hydroxy-5-carboxy-2-thiophenecarboxylate and imidazole mixed ligand.
